subject: The Calendar Is Coming
event: I won't be at this year's San Diego Comicon, alas. Had to miss the fun, but there's too much work to do, and I know that HBO and Random House and Tor have matters well in hand, with lots of great events and promotions. Which is not to say I won't be represented: the 2016 edition of the Official SONG OF ICE AND FIRE Calendar will be making its debut at San Diego. I was lucky enough to snag an advance copy. This year the artwork is by the amazing and talented French artist, MAGALI VILLENUEVE, whose past work includes some terrific contributions to Fantasy Flight's games and the WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE concordance. Check out more of her work at http://magali-villeneuve.blogspot.com/ and http://www.magali-villeneuve.com/ The calendars will be available at the Random House/ Bantam/ Del Rey booth at San Diego, so be sure and look them before the supply is gone. Magali has done some gorgeous work here; I expect you will love it as much as I do.

props.taglist: artwork, song of ice and fire, calendar

comments.article: Can't wait to buy it and see the artworks! Magali is fantastic artist. As i know it will be one art for TWOW in this?
I trust that all the months are labeled as *winter*?
Lol lol a+ comment

Hi George!
As I recall, the calendar would show an image from The Winds of Winter. Is is true? And it's an image from one of the chapters we already know - from readings or excerts in your web or app - or something completely original?

Thanks in advance for everything!
comments.subject: Image of Son of Kong in the calendar

comments.article: The official Penguin Random House's page for the calendar has a small sample, you can see the image there. Don't want to say who it is in case people don't want to be spoiled before they get their own copy.
comments.subject: Re: Image of Son of Kong in the calendar

comments.article:
you're so cute!!
It's amazing George, I can't wait, good work and kisses...
comments.subject: Amazing!

comments.article: Awesome! I don't suppose they'll be sold in other countries? Looks like some real eye candy. And... wait is that a White Walker's head lying there? O_o
comments.subject: *heavy breathing*

comments.article: I'm submitting a panel to New York Comic Con (in real life I have an MA in medieval History) - any small chance you will come to NYCC?  The TV writers weren't able to come to SDCC either...I wonder if they'll make up for it by coming to my hometown convention.
comments.subject: NYCC?

comments.article: Unlikely, I am afraid.  Right now I am cancelling appearances, not adding them.
comments.subject: Re: NYCC?

comments.article: Hey George! Is it true that the calendar contains artwork depicting a scene from The Winds of Winter?
comments.subject: Art from TWOW

comments.article:
I'm quite excited to get my copy of the calendar!

Is that Ser Duncan's sigil in the background I see? A lot of other awesomeness in this photo, too, there's tiny-you & an Other (or I guess a White Walker since it's the show's depiction) down there, plus the great dragon egg cookie jar in the background!
Wow, it looks gorgeous. It's so amazing to me how artists can bring your literary masterpieces to life. I guess that's why they're artists. I'm definitely getting one. Thanks for sharing.
comments.subject: Amazing Art

comments.article: Looks amazing George, do you know if Hastings will have it and if so when (in Albuquerque)
comments.subject: Calendar

comments.article: No idea.
comments.subject: Re: Calendar

comments.article: Yay!!! Calendar based on book descriptions...I'm in!!

Can't wait to check out the interior art. Last year's calendar was amazing.

BTW, I'm re-reading (actually, re-listening to the audio of) ASOIAF, and the depth and complexity of the plot and characters is just mind-blowing. Thank you for this awesome contribution to our culture. I never thought I'd say this of any author, but I do believe you have exceeded Tolkien.
comments.subject: Gorgeous cover!!

comments.article: I did not know that Magali was doing the art for this year's calendar. I play the card game and her art always stands out. She has also done my absolute favorite illustration of the Red Viper: http://www.cardgamedb.com/forums/uploads/7<wbr />6239072d19ece95dc6d4a8eaf6680cf.jpg
That's gotta be my favorite rendition of the Others that I've seen (and I look around for that kind of thing a lot). Magali Villenueve works magic - I hope there's a Dornish-themed piece in there.

When it will be available in Egypt ?!. You have a pretty big fanbase in Egypt and by miracle we can find your work in our country not counting song of ice and fire novels which is available everywhere in bookstores. I'm talking about world of ice and fire , tales of dunk and egg , wild cards , calendars and map books

thank you and take your time finishing son of kong I wish you the best for changing the fantasy genre .
One of these years I would love to visit Egypt.

The calendar looks great! Can't wait to pick it up. By chance is the "son of Kong" release date marked in the calendar for us?! Only half joking!! Thanks for staying strong and patiently talking to your fans via this site and continuing to work on A song of ice and fire under immense pressure. I can't imagine how tough it is to try and enjoy the life being a successful and genius author has afforded you while constantly being bombarded about when winter will come! Very Ironic in a lot of ways. "Heavy is the crown"! Thanks again your grace of westeros and beyond and hope to enjoy some of your other books. Read all of the Dunc and Eggs. Where should I start of the "wildcard" books? Haven't read any of them nor do I know much about em? Any suggestions. Sorry for taking up your time!
comments.subject: Calendar looks awesome

comments.article: For Wild Cards... start with either WILD CARDS or INSIDE STRAIGHT.
comments.subject: Re: Calendar looks awesome

comments.article: Hi, will you have signed copies of the calendar at the Jean Cocteau? Thank you.
Yes.
Great looking calendar. But when is the next book being released?

comments.article: The cover photo is gorgeous! That's Waymar Royce, right?

comments.article:
Hi George!

First I should ask for pardon, because my english knowledge is very bad, sorry. And so I beg for Permiss to put some Questions to you without courtesy because I cannot express myself in English with all required things.

This comment is only for answering yes/no, the comment with the Questions follows next.

Thank you und many greetings from Moscow.
a68
No problem with your English... but I am afraid I prefer not to answer questions about ICE & FIRE.  You can discuss these points with fellow fans on boards like Westeros.com and Tower of the Hand.

Hi, George. I enjoy your books very much and am a big fan.

I was wondering if you are going to do a promo tour once you have finished The Winds of Winter like you did for the other books. Have a nice day. :)
comments.subject: TWoW Tour

comments.article: I will do some promotion, certainly.  Whether it will be a full-on book tour, as with previous volumes, remains to be seen.
comments.subject: Re: TWoW Tour
